item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Tony Dungy believes Michael Vick focused on putting life back together
item.description: Tony Dungy says he believes Michael Vick is focused on putting his life back together.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: NFLPA executive director DeMaurice Smith: Roger Goodell's disciplinary authority will be subject of talks
item.description: The NFL players union wants to talk about commissioner Roger Goodell's power to discipline players when talks on a new collective bargaining agreement begin, union chief executive DeMaurice Smith said.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Michael Phelps loses in 200m butterfly final as Germany's Paul Biedermann sets world record
item.description: Germany's Paul Biedermann has handed Michael Phelps his first major individual loss in four years, setting a world record in the 200-meter freestyle at the world championships.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Manhattan district attorney wants Plaxico Burress in jail 'by trial or plea'
item.description: The attorney for Plaxico Burress said Monday night that he and the former New York Giants receiver, who shot himself in the thigh at a nightclub last year, have been discussing whether Burress will testify before the grand jury.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Soriano's slam lifts Cubs past Astros in 13th
item.description: Alfonso Soriano redeemed himself for an earlier mental miscue by hitting a game-ending grand slam in the 13th inning for the Cubs.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Brett Myers of Philadelphia Phillies working towards return to bullpen this season
item.description: Brett Myers, eyeing a sooner-than-expected recovery from hip surgery, might return to the Phillies as a reliever rather than as a starter.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Tony Kanaan says hands not burned, plans to race at Kentucky Speedway
item.description: Tony Kanaan does not have burns on his hands from a cockpit fuel fire in last weekend's Rexall Edmonton Grand Prix and plans to race Sunday at Kentucky Speedway, The Indianapolis Star reported.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Sources: Pete Rose's status the same, despite report
item.description: Pete Rose's status with baseball remains the same, despite a report that Bud Selig is "seriously considering" reinstatement of the hits king.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Alberto Contador: My relationship with Lance Armstrong is 'zero'
item.description: Alberto Contador and Lance Armstrong are sniping again after a fragile truce during the Tour de France.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Tony Bernazard, New York Mets executive, reportedly fired by New York Mets
item.description: Omar Minaya fired a team executive Monday for a series of blowups, then openly questioned the motives of a local beat writer.

item.dc:creator: Marc Stein
item.title: Sources: Hornets set to get Okafor for Chandler
item.description: Sources say the Bobcats and Hornets are in talks to trade Tyson Chandler for Emeka Okafor.

item.dc:creator: Marc Stein
item.title: Dwyane Wade of the Miami Heat continues recruitment of Lamar Odom in LA
item.description: Dwyane Wade announced via his Twitter account late Sunday night that he has flown to Los Angeles to bring Lamar Odom back to the Heat.

item.dc:creator: Shaun Assael
item.title: Second man claims ex-Indianapolis Colts WR Marvin Harrison shot him
item.description: A second man has filed suit against Marvin Harrison over a 2008 shooting.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: BCS changes open Rose Bowl bids to outsiders
item.description: Big Ten commissioner Jim Delany says some tweaking to the Bowl Championship Series rules has given greater access to the Rose Bowl to teams from outside the six conferences with automatic BCS bids -- such as Utah.
